Guide to College Admission and Aid
At Albright College, you`ll learn as much about yourself as about the world around you.

What makes us different? With so many colleges offering the same photos of attractive, smiling students lounging under blue skies, and the same lofty descriptions of their academic programs, why choose Albright? What should you know about us that makes us distinctive … and the right choice for you?

Quite a bit, actually. As you’ll read here, our curriculum, our campus, our programs and our people combine to create a unique collegiate experience. Everything you do at Albright, inside and outside the classroom, will challenge you as it nurtures you, introducing you to new ideas while teaching timeless concepts, and preparing you for a complex, interconnected and rapidly changing world.
At Albright, you're encouraged to blaze your own trail, tailor your educational experience to your interests, and find your place.
Our School of Professional Studies is just what you need to propel your career to the next level.

Albright College is accredited by the Middle States Commission on Higher Education, an institutional accrediting agency recognized by the U.S. Secretary of Education and the Commission on Recognition of Postsecondary Accreditation.
Tour the Places Where You'll Live and Learn

The next best thing to touring our beautiful, 118-acre campus in person is to check it out online. Take a virtual tour of our signature buildings and major facilities, our residence halls and our sports venues.

Guide to College Admission and Aid
We hear it over and over again: When students talk about why they chose Albright, they say that during their campus visit, the campus felt like home.

Maybe it’s our beautiful 118 acres, which allow room for exploration but never feel overwhelming. Maybe it’s our facilities, which provide the perfect setting to live and learn in. Maybe it’s the people of Albright, who are diverse in their backgrounds and interests, and always welcoming. It’s hard to put a finger on exactly what it is. That’s why we hope you’ll come experience Albright for yourself.
